intro: Androcalva argentea, commonly known as the silverleaf androcalva, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its silvery-gray leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Its unique foliage and delicate blooms make it a distinctive addition to botanical collections.
